citation.article-title: Bacillus velezensis is a later heterotypic synonym of Bacillus amyloliquefaciens.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Bacillus amyloliquefaciens (ex Fukumoto 1943) Priest et al. 1987
The description is the same as that given by Priest et al. (1987) except for the following traits.
Strains are capable of growing in NaCl concentrations up to 12 % w/v.
Citrate utilization and Tween 20 hydrolysis are variable.
They are able to produce dihydroxyacetone, but do not produce lecithinase.
Acid is produced from aesculin, amygdalin, l-arabinose, arbutin, glycogen, inositol, lactose, methyl α-d-glycoside, raffinose, d-ribose, salicin, sorbitol, starch, d-xylose, galactose and inulin.
H2S production and ONPG reaction are strain-dependent.
Tests for degradation of indole, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase and phenylalanine deaminase are negative.
Major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0, according to this study and Ruiz-García et al. (2005).
The DNA G+C content ranges from 44 to 46 mol%.
Strains have been isolated from desert soils and brackish sediments.
Additional chemotaxonomic data and biochemical tests are given in Supplementary Tables S1 and S2.
The type strain is Fukumoto strain FT=ATCC 23350T=DSM 7T=BCRC 11601T=CIP 103265T=IFO (now NBRC) 15535T=LMG 12234T=NCIMB 12077T=NRRL B-14393T.
